node.title: Tom Brady's 2005 60 Minutes interview
node.description: When the quarterback had won 3 Super Bowls, he told 60 Minutes his favorite Super Bowl ring was his "next one." Brady announced his retirement Tuesday.
node.content: ["Seven-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback Tom Brady has announced his retirement after 22 years in the NFL. Brady, 44, made the announcement in a series of social media posts, saying, \"Right now, it's best I leave the field of play to the next generation of dedicated and committed athletes.\"", "60 Minutes correspondent Steve Kroft spoke with Brady in 2005, when he was just 27 years old. He spoke about his love for the game, which great NFL quarterbacks he wanted to emulate, and the scouting report that described him as \"poor build, very skinny.\"", "At the time, Brady already had three Super Bowl wins to his name\u2014and told Kroft he wondered what else life had in store.", "\"I think, God, it's got to be more than this,\" Brady said. \"I mean this can't be what it's all cracked up to be.\"", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
